paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Belonuchus
Nordmann 1837 : 129
. Type species:
Staphylinus haemorrhoidalis Fabricius, 1801
, by monotypy.

=
Musicoderus
Sharp 1885 : 455
. Type species:
Musicoderus cephalotes Sharp 1885
, des. by
Lucas 1920 : 425
. Notes: as subgenus of
Belonuchus (
Bernhauer 1916c: 266
)
; as synonym of
Belonuchus (
Blackwelder 1943: 421
)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes: There are 165 valid species of
Belonuchus
distributed in CASA . A recent study (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
) shows
Belonuchus
as a genus of Neotropical origin and generic limits so far undefined. The current concept of the genus is that of Smetana (1995) , Chani-Posse (2014a) and
Chani-Posse et al. (2018)
but most of its Neotropical endemic species were never revised after being described and they do not fit into this concept. Species that may belong to the so called ‘
Belonuchus haemorrhoidalis
clade’ (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
) are here denoted with an asterisk *.

*
Belonuchus abnormalis ( Sharp 1885 )
,
comb. nov.
( Figs. 1–2 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus abnormalis
Sharp 1885 : 397
. Type locality:
Mexico
: Oaxaca . Type depository: BMNH 2 ST: 1 ♂ , 1 ♀ [ MCP seen]. Distribution:
Mexico
,
Guatemala
. Note: distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. Sharp explicitly mentioned two specimens (male and female) as part of the type series. The two specimens listed below agree with the original description by Sharp (1885) and considered to have been syntypes prior to the present lectotype designation.

Type material examined.
Lectotype ♂ , here designated ( BMNH , Figs. 1–2 ): card-mounted, “ ♂ (in ink) Philonthus abnormalis Type D.S. Oaxaca .
Mexico
. Höge [in Sharp’s hand] // Type (round white label with red margin) // Oaxaca ,
Mexico
. Hoege. (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus abnormalis, Sharp. (white label) // Sharp Coll. 1905.-313. (white label)”. Paralectotype ♀ ( BMNH ): with same locality and collection data as lectotype , and additional printed white label “Sp. Figured”.

Comments. In accordance with the diagnosis of
Belonuchus (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
)
; determined as “
Belonuchus
” by J. L. Navarrete-Heredia in 2002.

subSubSection.paragraph:
*
Belonuchus celatus ( Sharp 1885 )
,
comb. nov.
( Figs. 3–4 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus celatus
Sharp 1885 : 420
. Type locality: Mexico : Mirador
,
Oaxaca , Tehuacan, Yolos, Cuernavaca. Type depository: BMNH 10 ST: from all type localities [ MCP seen]. Distribution : Mexico
. Note: distribution within Mexico (
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. Sharp did not specify the number of specimens he examined for naming this species, but it seems likely that he based his description on at least two specimens of different sex. Ten specimens were located in the BMNH under this name. All the ten specimens listed below agree with the original description by Sharp (1885) and are considered to have been syntypes prior to the present lectotype designation.

Type material examined. Lectotype ♂, here designated (BMNH, Figs. 3–4 ): card-mounted, “ Philonthus celatus Type D.S. Oaxaca. Höge” [in Sharp’s hand] // Type (round white label with red margin) // Oaxaca, Mexico. Hoege (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus celatus, Sharp. (white label) // Sharp Coll. 1905.-313. (white label)”. Paralectotypes (BMNH): 2 ♀, one of them “Cuernavaca” (white label) [in Sharp’s hand], the other one “Yolos” (white label) [in Sharp’s hand], both of them with the following additional labels, “Mexico. Salle. Coll (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus celatus, Sharp. (white label)”; 1 ♂, 4 ♀, card-mounted, ♂ with “ Philonthus celatus Mirador. Höge ” [in Sharp’s hand]), “Mirador, Mexico. Hoege (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus celatus, Sharp. (white label)”; 2 ♀, card-mounted (one of them also “ Philonthus celatus Type D.S. Tehuacan. Höge” [in Sharp’s hand]), “Tehuacan, Mexico. Hoege (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus celatus, Sharp. (white label)”.

Comments. In accordance with the diagnosis of
Belonuchus (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
)
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. Sharp did not specify the number of specimens he examined for naming this species, but obviously he based his description on more than two specimens, including male/s and female/s. Eight specimens were located in the BMNH under this name. The specimens below agree with the original description by Sharp (1885) and considered to have been syntypes prior to the present lectotype designation.

Type material examined. Lectotype ♂, here designated (BMNH): card-mounted (with additional label “Sp. figured”), “ Philonthus infimus Las Mercedes 3000 ft . Guatemala Champion. [in Sharp’s hand] // Las Mercedes 3000 ft . Champion. (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus infimus, Sharp. (white label) // Sharp Coll. 1905.-313. (white label)”. Paralectotypes (BMNH): 2 ♂, 2 ♀, card-mounted (one ♀ with additional “Type” round white label with red margin and “Type D.S” on the mounting card [in Sharp’s hand]), “ Philonthus infimus Las Mercedes 3000 ft . Guat. Champion. [in Sharp’s hand] // Las Mercedes 3000 ft . Champion. (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus infimus, Sharp. (white label)”; 2 ♀, card-mounted, “ Philonthus infimus D.S. [in Sharp’s hand] // V. de Chiriqui 4–3000 ft Champion (white label) // B. C. A. Col. I. 2. Philonthus infimus, Sharp. (white label)”.

Comments. In accordance with the diagnosis of
Belonuchus (
Chani-Posse et al. 2018
)
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks. Although references about three different type localities on different dates and a male character are given in the original description, there is no indication about how many specimens were examined. Two specimens were located in the FMNH under this name. The specimen below agrees with the original description and considered to have been a syntype .

Type material examined. Syntype ♂ (FMNH, Figs. 47–48 ): card mounted with cutouts at head-thorax and abdomen // Süd – Peru Oberh. Paleo, 3240m 10.4.1936 [in Bernhauer’s hand] (green label) // Hbg. – Süd – Peru Sammelreise 1936. Eing. Nr. 1, 1937 (green label) // 219 (white label) // Philonthus excelsus Brh. Cotypus (white label) // excelsus Benh. Typus Philonthus [in Bernhauer’s hand](red label) // Chicago NHMus M.Bernhauer Collection (white label)”.
